title: James Argent reveals he has eating disorder and weighs 23.5 stone
text:
James Argent has revealed he's battling an eating disorder in his first interview since ex Gemma Collins called paramedics to his home amid fears he had 'overdosed'.

The former TOWIE star, 31, has told OK! that he's seeing a therapist to help him through his binge eating disorder, which led to him tipping the scales at 23.5 stone.

He said: 'When I'm in a bad place I binge eat, and when I put on weight it triggers more issues. I have been aware of the issue for a long time, but I still struggle with it so I'm speaking with my therapist about changing my relationship with food.'

Speaking out: James Argent has revealed he's battling an eating disorder in his first interview since ex Gemma Collins called paramedics to his home amid fears he had 'overdosed'

Arg, who has struggled with the disorder since his teens, said of his subsequent weight gain: 'I was the biggest I've ever been, which was 23 stone and a half, but I've lost two stone. At my healthiest I've been 15 stone, and I want to be back there.'

The TV personality, who plans to lose six stone in six months, has now focused on keeping himself active with the help of some celebrity friends.

'The best thing I can do is eat healthily, and get down to the gym four times a week,' he said. 'Rebecca Adlington has said she's going to take me to the Olympic pool in Stratford. I need to make sure I have structure in my life, and keep myself busy doing positive things.'

Eating disorder: The former TOWIE star, 31, has told OK! that he's seeing a therapist to help him through his binge eating disorder, which led to him tipping the scales at 23.5 stone

James's revealing interview has been unveiled less than two weeks after his ex Gemma called emergency services over fears he had overdosed.

According to The Sun, police 'broke into' the TOWIE star's home after he failed to return his friends' phone calls.





Two police cars and two ambulance crews made their way to Arg's £1.3million north-east London home over concerns he had collapsed.

According to the publication, Gemma, 38, dialled 999 after Arg's parents were unable to get into his house where he lives by himself.

Medics examined the reality star and his parents reportedly insisted that they could look after him.

Concerns: James's revealing interview has been unveiled less than two weeks after his ex Gemma Collins called emergency services over fears he had overdosed. Pictured in 2018

However, three hours later they are said to have raised the alarm again over 'further concerns for his welfare'.

In a statement given to The Sun, James insisted he was fine and the reason he did not answer his phone was because he 'wasn't speaking to a certain person'.

He said: ‘I wasn’t speaking to a certain person so I didn’t reply. They became concerned and called the police and ambulance. They turned up and checked on me. They came up to my room to make sure I was fine.’

The ambulance crew reportedly arrived to his home in South Woodford shortly before 1pm with the police arriving soon after.

When the cops got inside, they assessed Arg but then got a second call at 4:20pm before a third ambulance arrived.

Embarrassed: James later said he was 'embarrassed' by the buss. Pictured in November 2017

Arg said his parents were already in his home checking up on him when 'this person' called the emergency services again.

After the ambulance arrived at his house after 4pm, Arg said he had a quick chat with them on his doorstep, adding the police and paramedics were only at his house for about 10 minutes.

The reality star added that he was 'slightly embarrassed' by the incident and apologised for any wasted police time as he was 'absolutely fine'.

The Metropolitan Police said in a statement: ‘Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant.

Weight loss goals: Arg is now on a mission to bring his weight down to 15 stone in six months

'Officers attended with LAS (London Ambulance Service). The male, in his 30s, was spoken to. He was left in the company of family. Officers were called at 16.21hrs to the same address, again due to concerns for the same male’s welfare. The male declined assistance.’

He has since returned to work, and was seen singing on stage in Majorca, Spain, last Wednesday for the first time since the incident.

The reality star looked happy and healthy on as he performed during the £20-a-head headline gig at Stadium 63 bar in Palma Nova.

Breaking out his crooner classics while dressed in a smart blue shirt, The Mirror reported that James told fans he had a difficult week.

Mission: He recently joined a host of stars, including Love Island's Wes Nelson, to compete in Sink Or Swim For Stand Up To Cancer

'Ladies and gentlemen, my name is James 'Arg' Argent. It's been a hell of a week for me, it's been a tough week but I'm so glad to be here tonight,' he told the cheering crowd.

'You've really all cheered me up,' he said before he launched into a rendition of Fly Me to the Moon.

Arg was said to have been sacked from TOWIE after failing a routine drug test, leaving his friends worried about his health.

A source told The Sun that Arg voluntarily agreed to the routine test before he returned to filming because of concerns over his previous issues with drugs and alcohol.

The insider added that the production crew of TOWIE are very fond of him and hope he can overcome his issues.

New passion: The show has ignited a passion for swimming for the star, who has said that Rebecca Adlington plans to take him to the Olympic pool in Stratford, east London

During a previous appearance on ITV's This Morning, James spoke about his weight, saying he believes he replaces substance abuse with food.

He said: 'I'm proud at myself I've been able to do really well career wise in the last nine months, I’ve stayed sober but instead of me going out with mates doing drugs... I’m probably acting out on food.'

In August last year, Arg returned to rehab following a split from Gemma in a brave bid to tackle his demons.

The TV star spent three months in a facility in Thailand over the festive season in 2016 in a bid to curb his wild ways and revealed that he checked himself in to a programme in order to get the 'ongoing support' he needed.

He also spent time in The Priory for alleged drink and drug issues in 2014.
